info.name: Plugo Partner API
info.description:
It's Integration API Document for partner company.

Only up to **100 requests per second** are allowed.

**\[Common Request Header Guide\]**

**For partnerID/partnerPASS**, enter the value issued by Plugo.

**For Plugo API Key**, Value issued by Plugo must be delivered from the seller

**For timeStamp**

- Value is the time of request in UTC. (**Format : YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss**)
    
- Any timesStamp older than 30 min. will be rejected by the system
    

**SignedKey rule**: SHA256(timeStamp + vendorID + partnerPASS + Plugo API Key)

- **Example**
    
- timeStamp: "2024-02-29 12:34:56"
    
- vendorID: 100
    
- partnerPASS: "partner"
    
- Plugo API Key: "api-key"
    
- **Result**: 215daaf8c61c9b204aeb4bc140791d041d1fff833c88a081c933596ebf85abec

## Filter List **Usage**: {{baseUrl}}/v1/locationsCount?ids=123,456&name=jakarta | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | ids | Number | Filter Locations equal to comma-separated location id list
**(ex. ids=123,456)** | | limit | Number | limit for paging **(default: 50, maximun: 250)** | | offset | Number | offset for paging **(default: 0)** | | name | String | Filter Locations equal to name | | name_contains | String | Filter Locations equal to comma-separated name list
**(ex. name_contains=cenkarang,jakarta)** | | phone | String | Filter Locations equal to phone | | phone_contains | String | Filter Locations equal to comma-separated phone list
**(ex. phone_contains=08123456789,08123456788)** | | active | Boolean | Filter Locations activated |

**(format: 2020-07-26T21:26:44Z)** | | createdAt_max | String | Filter Products created before date

The variations of the product will be replaced by the value of the request body. If there are existing variations of the product, please send a request by adding or modifying variation in variations of the product.

request.description:
## Filter List **Usage**: {{baseUrl}}/v1/ordersCount?status=paid | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | ids | Number | Filter Orders equal to comma-separated order id list
**(ex. ids=123,456)** | | limit | Number | limit for paging **(default: 50, maximun: 250)** | | offset | Number | offset for paging **(default: 0)** | | status | String | Filter Orders equal to status | | status__contain | String | Filter Orders equal to comma-separated status
**(ex. status__contain=new,paid)** | | type | String | Filter Orders equal to type | | paymentType | String | Filter Orders equal to payment type | | dropshipper | Boolean | Filter Orders dropshipping | | paidAt_min | String | Filter Orders paid after Date
**(format: 2020-07-26T21:26:44Z)** | | paidAt_max | String | Filter Orders paid before Date
**(format: 2020-07-26T21:26:44Z)** | | createdAt_min | String | Filter Orders created after Date
**(format: 2020-07-26T21:26:44Z)** | | createdAt_max | String | Filter Orders created before Date
**(format: 2020-07-26T21:26:44Z)** | | updatedAt_min | String | Filter Orders updated after Date
**(format: 2020-07-26T21:26:44Z)** | | updatedAt_max | String | Filter Orders updated before Date
**(format: 2020-07-26T21:26:44Z)** |

# Filter List

Same as \[GET\] List Count

## Filter Usecase

### Check the updated orders for a specific range?

**Usage**: `{{baseUrl}}/v1/orders?updatedAt_min=2022-01-01T00:00:00Z&updatedAt_max=2022-01-10T00:00:00Z`

(range: `2022-01-01T00:00:00Z <= updatedAt < 2022-01-10T00:00:00Z`)

### What if there are a lot of orders? (with paging)

#### Page 1

`{{baseUrl}}/v1/orders?updatedAt_min=2022-01-01T00:00:00Z&updatedAt_max=2022-01-10T00:00:00Z&limit=100&offset=0`

#### Page 2

`{{baseUrl}}/v1/orders?updatedAt_min=2022-01-01T00:00:00Z&updatedAt_max=2022-01-10T00:00:00Z&limit=100&offset=100`

#### Page N is the same way

The unique identifier of the order | | vendorId | **"vendorId": 1**
The order owner's unique identifier | | status | **"status": "paid"**
The status of the order | | createdAt | Created at timestamp of an order (ISO 8601) | | updatedAt | Updated at timestamp of an order at the event time (ISO 8601) | ## Webhook Payload(Request Body) ``` javascript { "vendorId": 1, "data": { "orderId": 15375, "vendorId": 6555, "status": "new", "createdAt": "2024-12-17T06:37:03.895Z", "updatedAt": "2024-12-17T06:37:03.895Z" } } ```

item.description:
# Limitation

The `inventories` webhook category is currently exclusive to Packhai. Please contact us to request access.

# Webhook Topics

| Topic | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| orders/create | Order Created |
| orders/update | Order Updated |

We will send a HTTP request with payload in POST method when an event of a topic occurs with the registered webhook url.

(If you have not yet registered a webhook URL,

**please check the \[Partners\]-\[Update WebhookUrl\]** section of the Postman document and register the webhook URL first.)

ex. If Webhook URL is [https://example.com/webhooks](https://example.com/webhooks),

We will Send to \[POST\] [https://example.com/webhooks](https://example.com/webhooks) with Webhook payload(Request Body)

## Webhook Headers

- X-Plugo-Topic: `orders/create`
    
- X-Plugo-Verify-Key: `3cd7b3fd23900cd8f07ca3e4e1429b25e5ffe50e47486bbcfa8505b8bcc6f428`
    

**X-Plugo-Verify-Key Rule**: SHA256(PartnerPASS)

## Webhook Payload

ex. If topic is `orders/create`, webhook's payload will looks like this

``` javascript
{
    "vendorId": 1,
    "data": Order
}

 ```

ex. If topic is `orders/update`, webhook's payload will looks like this

``` javascript
{
    "vendorId": 1,
    "data": Order
}

 ```

For more detailed explanation, you can check payload in each topic section below.
